data.title: Toggle word wrap affects all tabs in an editor slot
data.body:
Spotted by @michelkaporin in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/21801#issuecomment-290037559

* Have two minified files a.txt and b.txt
* open both of them in an editor 
* toggle word wrap on one of them
* switch tabs to the other one
* observe that the toggle word wrap influences the other one too

data.title: don't add artificial newline characters in debug console
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a file.js with the code below:
```
process.stdout.write('Working...');
process.stdout.write('done!');
```
2. Run it and see the words are not on the same line in DEBUG CONSOLE.

Actual output:
```
Working...
done!
```
Expected result:
```
Working...done!
```
(the same as in windows command prompt or other terminal emulators)

data.title: Auto import quotes sign should be configured by tslint.json for Typescript
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. add to tslint.json
```
{"rules": {
 "quotemark": [true, "single"],
}}
```
2. Add to a.ts 
`export const a = 1;`
3. Add to b.ts
a
3. Click on auto suggestion, then import
4. See imported string with tslint warning about double quotes

Expect:
import with single quotes with no warning

data.title: Keyboard becomes unresponsive while playing World Of Tanks
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Home Version 1607 OS Build 14393.953

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Start up vscode
2. Start up World of Tanks and play a game. Gradually, the keyboard will become unresponsive, you will become useless and die. I run this full screen in HD mode.

data.title: Too many messages in the git output view

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #23305
- looking at the git output there are a lot of messages for commands that I did not actively trigger
```
git fetch
git status -z -u
git symbolic-ref --short HEAD
git rev-parse master
git rev-parse --symbolic-full-name --abbrev-ref master@{u}
git rev-list --left-right master...origin/master
git for-each-ref --format %(refname) %(objectname)
git remote --verbose
git show HEAD:.vscode/tasks.json
```
While I mostly don't care, it is annoying when look at errors that I care about. E.g. the message of a commit hook. Often the error message scrolls away and I have to find it again

Maybe have different modes, such as a verbose mode and a standard mode that only shows errors?

data.title: Do not show multiple breakpoints for wrapped lines
data.body:
![2017-03-29_11-03-12](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/24451315/9708b3fe-147e-11e7-951e-cbfb3ba31274.png)

Since we are not showing multiple line numbers in this case, I don't think that we should show multiple breakpoints.

data.title: Incomplete messages in error dialog
data.body:
Testing #23305

- have some unstaged changes and have a branch with some commits behind
- run 'push' from the view menu
- error dialog shows up:
 Error: Git: To https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode.git

The git output view shows:
```
git push
To https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode.git
 ! [rejected]        master -> master (non-fast-forward)
error: failed to push some refs to 'https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode.git'
hint: Updates were rejected because the tip of your current branch is behind
hint: its remote counterpart. Integrate the remote changes (e.g.
hint: 'git pull ...') before pushing again.
hint: See the 'Note about fast-forwards' in 'git push --help' for details.
```

The error message isn't really useful here. Maybe better show a generic message?

data.title: Compare 2 files with multi selection
data.body:
Ref: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/30139597/visual-studio-code-is-there-a-compare-feature-like-that-plugin-for-notepad

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

A similar comparing tool as the plugin explained in StackOverflow above. Currently, VSCode does not allow multi select and also ability to edit the compared files (only the file to the right is allowed). 

Features Request:
1. Multi-select files in the tabs
2. Compare and edit both the files
3. Ability to not refresh in real time (or allow it)

data.title: Search term in keybindings editor is not saved

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.0
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:

0. Open new Keybindings editor.
1. Enter 'workbench.action' search term in keybindings.
2. Navigate to another editor tab.
3. Return back -> Search term is gone.

**Expectation**: similar behaviour to settings.json editor, where the search term is saved upon editor model change.

Great job on keybindings editor @sandy081 !

data.title: Ripgrep: can't search for a query containing a space, using the 'whole word' flag
data.body:
Testing #23319

Version 1.11.0-insider
Commit 646d0f9e0db0c60f81b099472f4a9e3a722744b1
Date 2017-03-28T12:36:25.374Z

Linux

In the vscode repo, search with `whole word` enabled
- 'Remove ' without ripgrep: 357 matches, with ripgrep 0 matches
- 'Remove on' without ripgrep: 1 match, with ripgrep 0 matches
- '${1:': with ripgrep: 21 matches, without ripgrep: 235 matches

I agree it's discussable what it 'whole word' means for a search term that is more than a word. But just wanted to bring it to your attention.

data.title: Adding missing imports - feature or bug?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.11.0-insider (d98a518c5485bd7a47c70f5b3783f70efa5edcd6, 2017-03-29T06:11:14.271Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.1.0|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.8.1|
|auto-close-tag|formulahendry|0.3.10|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.0.2|
|vscode-tfs|ivangabriele|0.6.0|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.11.0|
|typescript-javascript-grammar|ms-vscode|0.0.18|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.7.1|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.4.0|


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Try to add some missing imports (click on light bulb)
2. Everything works fine except it adds path like this:
import { CtrlCommunicator } from "src/app/Services/CtrlCommunicator";

when webpack require from me something like this: 
import { CtrlCommunicator } from './../Services/CtrlCommunicator';

Also tslint in most cases require single comma ' rather then double commas "

I'm not sure it is a bug (plugins like Auto import https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=steoates.autoimport works as expected with single comma and reference path)  or maybe feature request to add posibility to configure import?
